skillTree.localised_description: True horses no longer, Dark Magic corrupts the finest Elven steeds and turns them into black-flanked killers.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: Dark, feral beasts indigenous to Naggaroth, tempted from their damp, warm caves to bear the Druchii to battle.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

skillTree.localised_description: The corrupted Dark Pegasi fly south from the Chaos Wastes to Naggaroth's Iron Mountains to make their nests.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

skillTree.localised_description: The roar of a Manticore is guaranteed to send mortals fleeing, for they know a creature of terror is abroad.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can fly.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

skillTree.localised_description: Secretly nurtured by Malekith, Black Dragons are enchanted with Dark Magic that corrupts and enhances.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

skillTree.localised_description: It is easy to favour Hekarti - who pays close attention to Elven desires - over Atharti, but only the foolish allow that to happen.

effects.description:
Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +8
	(own army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Bloody-handed God watches over his disciples.
Magic's dark mistress has a care for her dutiful acolytes.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

skillTree.localised_description: This one has adopted a warrior name to strike fear into enemy hearts, a moniker backed up by their deeds in battle.

effects.description: Choose a Name of Power that improves the Lord's own combat skills

skillTree.localised_description: This one's chosen name is muttered in hushed tones, reflecting as it does their vile proclivities.

effects.description: Choose a Name of Power that improves the Lord's army

skillTree.localised_description: Some family names are best forgotten; others are worthy of resurrection, as they engender fear and respect among the masses.

effects.description: Choose a Name of Power that influences the province in which Lord is standing or the faction as a whole

skillTree.localised_description: The ancient archives of Ghrond contain secrets that can preserve life - or annihilate it.

target_if: Not on or below a platform

Wielding the shield is better than returning on it. (This skill can accept up to 20 Skill Points)

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Magic is a most useful tool on the field of battle, but generally secondary in the face of good, old-fashioned brute force.

skillTree.localised_description: The most effective raiders have a plan that is certain to succeed and stick to it; this one ensures that they do.

skillTree.localised_description: An elite even amongst elites, this accomplished warrior directs the cut-and-thrust of melee - a choreographer of death, you might say.

skillTree.localised_description: You'd think that pillaging the land would bring payment enough. You'd be wrong.

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This Lord expects utter obedience from the smallfolk, and has little time for insurrections or petty revolts.
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
If there were annals detailing the dastardly deeds of the sackers and looters of the world, this inveterate brigand would feature heavily.
Someone has to ensure the numbers and quality of recruits remain high.

effects.description:
Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: A good quartermaster can ration equipment and foodstuffs efficiently, making supplies last longer.
Knowing precisely where and when to launch an ambush, and against who, takes an unusual level of guile.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

skillTree.localised_description: The ancient Asur arts teach one how to heal as well as how to harm.

effects.description:
Attrition: -10% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -20% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

Attrition: -30% casualties suffered from all attrition
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

Recruit rank: +1 for all units
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

backgroundSkills.localised_description: To cause another's suffering, to delight in their pain, to extend their agony according to your whim. That is power.

effects.description: Attacks cause "Disembowelled" effect, draining hit points

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +500 metres without incurring any time penalty

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Evil-minded, poisonous malignancy. For its own sake.
When this one is abroad you can be sure that malice is borne towards anyone and everyone.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -40% for Cult of Khaine or Cult of Pleasure buildings
	(local region)

Hero recruit rank: +2 for Death Hags
	(local province)

attributes.bullet_text:
A Rampaging unit is uncontrollable and will attack the nearest enemy unit.
	When there are no enemy units nearby, a Rampaging unit will move around randomly instead.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Behind every thought they have - and every deed - is shameless, full-blooded spite.

related_attributes.bullet_text: Witnessing other friendly units rout will only affect this unit's leadership if they also have the Contempt attribute.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: "Some folk call me vicious. I'll scoop out the eyes of any who utter it in my presence."

enabled_if: Unit has exceeded the murderous prowess value

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight or when trying to get away afterwards!

attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +15%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).
